title: Sour Bicycles Moves its Frame Production to Germany and Drops the Big Fun Hardtail
content:
Sour Bicycles, the company that made the Pasta Party John reviewed last month, has just dropped a big bomb of an announcement. The brand will be producing all of its frames in Germany, beginning in January 2022. That means if you pre-order any frame right now, it’ll be made in Germany, including its newest model the Big Fun, an enduro/trail/all-mountain hardtail. Check out the geo numbers and details on the Big Fun below and read Sour Bicycles’ full press release at their blog…

Big Fun Specs:
Handmade Sour Bicycles CrMo frame
Tubing: heat treated, multiple butted tubing
Dropouts: new dropout design with replaceable derailleur hanger
Seat clamp: new integrated seat clamp
Headtube: ZS44/56 mm
Bottom bracket: 73 mm bsa
Axle: 12mm x 148mm boost thru axle
Seat post: 31.6mm seatpost diameter
Brake standard: IS2000
Recommended fork travel: 140 mm – 160 mm
Wheel size: 29“
Tire clearance: for up to 2.6″
More facts: external cable routing, dropper post entry in the seat tube, two water bottle options
